instance.context:
the unauthorized interference in a
legal_action by a person having no interest in it ( as by helping one party with money or otherwise to continue the action ) so as to obstruct justice or promote unnecessary litigation or unsettle the peace of the community ;

a
legal_action brought against parties who are charged with limiting free competition in the market_place ;
legal_action to protect a private civil_right or to compel a civil remedy ( as distinguished from criminal_prosecution ) ;

a claim filed in opposition to another claim in a
legal_action ;

a
legal_action to determine custody ( usually of children following a divorce ) ;

a representative
legal_action whose outcome is likely to become a precedent ;

a statute prescribing the time_period during which
legal_action can be taken ;

place on the docket for
legal_action ;
